qas.question: What types of degrees were earned at al-Qarawiyin University?
What religious buildings were housed inside al-Qarawiyin University?
What types of teachers were at al-Qarawiyin University?

context: al-Qarawīyīn University in Fez, Morocco is recognised by many historians as the oldest degree-granting university in the world, having been founded in <a0_0>859<a0_0/> by <a1_0>Fatima al-Fihri<a1_0/>. While the madrasa college could also issue degrees at <a2_0>all levels<a2_0/>, the jāmiʻahs (such as al-Qarawīyīn and al-Azhar University) differed in the sense that they were larger institutions, more universal in terms of their complete source of studies, had <a4_0>individual faculties for different subjects<a4_0/>, and could house a number of <a3_0>mosques<a3_0/>, madaris, and other institutions within them. Such an institution has thus been described as an "Islamic university".
